attributes.action: reassign the Indian aid budget to a nation in chronic need, recognising India as a truly great nation exemplified by the outstanding achievements of its space programme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The massive strides India has taken since independance are exemplified in the outstanding achievements of its space programme.

India has truly moved on from its colonial past and should be welcomed into the club of mature democracies.

For this reason it seems demeaning that the country should still receive charity from the UK Government's Department for International Development in the form of £825 million of aid, over 3 years, pledged in January this year.

http://www.dfid.gov.uk/news/files/pressreleases/india-aidpackage-825million.asp

This money should be reassigned to countries that are chronically underdeveloped.  At the same time the UK Government should vigorously pursue free trade agreements that allow poorer nations to trade out of poverty rather than rely on handouts.
